technical-data.invention-title: Microwave position sensing for a turbo machine
Détection de position à micro-ondes pour machine turbo

address.street: Dehns St Bride's House 10 Salisbury Square

description.p: This invention relates to sensing the position of various components associated with a turbo machine using a common microwave generator.

Various position sensing systems exist such as variable displacement transducers and Hall effect proximity probes. However, these systems are not suitable in many instances for turbo machines due to limited accuracy and the hostile environment within which they must perform.
US 2006/0048581 discloses a method of monitoring the vibration status of components in turbine machinery using high frequency pulse radar.

Microwave frequency signals have been used to detect the clearance of a turbine component within a turbo machine. A microwave generator produces a signal that is reflected by the turbine component and processed to detect the position of the turbine component.

The position of numerous components within a turbo machine system must be monitored. For example, the vibration and speed of the turbine must be measured along with the position of a variable stator vane, fuel metering valve, rotary actuators and numerous other components. However, it is cost prohibitive to employ a microwave generator for each component. What is needed is a microwave position sensing system that cost effectively monitors the position of numerous target components within a turbo machine.

Viewed from a first aspect, the present invention provides a microwave position sensing system comprising a plurality of target components each movable between multiple positions; a microwave generator producing a microwave frequency signal; and a divider configured to receive the microwave frequency signal, to split the microwave frequency signal into a plurality of position sensing signals, and to send the position sensing signals to the plurality of target components for determining a position of the target component associated therewith, characterised in that the microwave frequency signal includes a calibration signal operating at a first frequency and reflected prior to reacting the target component, and at least one of the plurality of position sensing signals corresponding to a second frequency that is different to the first frequency.

Viewed from a second aspect, the present invention provides a method of position sensing using microwaves comprising the steps of: a) transmitting a microwave signal; b) dividing the microwave signal into multiple position sensing signals; c) transmitting the multiple position sensing signals to a plurality of target components; and d) determining a position of each of the target components using the multiple position sensing signals; characterised by e) using a calibration signal to adjust the multiple position sensing signals, wherein the calibration signal is at a first frequency and is reflected prior to reacting the target component, and the position sensing signal is at a second frequency that is different to the first frequency; and wherein the microwave frequency signal contains the calibration and position sensing signals.
Certain preferred embodiments will now be described by way of example only and with reference to the accompanying drawings.
The example microwave position system and method cost effectively monitor the position of multiple target components using a common microwave generator.

heading.b: DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THE PREFERRED EMBODIMENT

description.p: Figure 1 is a highly schematic view of a turbo machine 10 that utilizes a microwave position sensing system 12. The turbo machine 10 includes a turbine 14 having multiple blades 16. Typically it is desirable to monitor the clearance between the turbine and adjacent housing and to monitor the vibration and speed of the turbine. The turbo machine 10 also includes a variable stator 18 having vanes 20 for which the position is monitored. The turbo machine 10 may also include various rotary actuators 22; fuel metering valves 24, linear actuators and other components that are monitored.

The microwave position sensing system 12 includes a processor 26 that communicates with a microwave generator 28 using, for example, command and feedback signals 30 and 32. The various arrows used in the schematics are illustrative only and are in no way intended as limiting. For example, single and/or multiple signals may carried by single and/or multiple wires. Alternatively, the signals may be communicated using wireless transmission. Moreover, more or fewer communications may be carried out than represented by the lines in the schematics.

The microwave generator 28 provides a microwave frequency signal 34 to a divider 36. The microwave frequency signal may include one or more distinct frequencies or a range of frequencies. The divider 36 splits the microwave frequency signal 34 into multiple position sensing signals 38 mechanically and/or electrically, as will be discussed in greater detail relative to Figures 2 and 3.

With continuing reference to Figure 1, the divider 36 provides multiple position sensing signals 38a-38e (collectively referred to as "38") to multiple target components, such as the turbine 14, variable stator 18, rotary actuator 22, and fuel metering valve 24. In the example shown, the fuel metering valve 24 includes a ramped surface that reflects the position sensing signal 38e.

As is known in the use of microwave frequencies for detecting position, the microwave signal is directed at a target, and the phase and signal strength of the frequency reflected from the target is measured to determine the position of the target. The reflected signal may bypass the divider 36 and be communicated directly to the processor 26. Typically the signal is carried to the target by a valve guide, as is known in the art. The frequency used for each target is selected based upon the distance of the target and other factors.

In one example, the position sensing signals 38 can be calibrated using a temperature sensor 40a-40e (collectively referred to as "40") located near by the respective position sensing signal 38a-38e. The temperature sensors 40 account for any thermal growth in the target component and/or wave guide associated with the target component.

Referring to the example shown in Figure 2, the divider 36 receives the microwave frequency signal 34 and electrically splits the signal to provide two position sensing signals 38a and 38b. The microwave frequency signal 34 passes through a timer 42 that sequentially delivers the microwave frequency 34 to first and second couplers 48a and 48b respectively with coaxial cables 46a and 46b. Additionally or alternatively, the microwave frequency signal 34 may pass through filters or multipliers 44a and 44b to deliver the desired frequency (or frequencies) to the respective coupler 48a and 48b.

The couplers 48a and 48b transmit the electrical signal to corresponding wave guides 50a and 50b to deliver the position sensing signals 38a and 38b to respective target components 52a and 52b. The position sensing signal 38a and 38b is reflected by its respective target component and transmitted back through the respective wave guides and couplers. Ultimately, the position sensing signals are received back by the processor 26, which translates the phase and signal strength of the return signal to a position associated with the target component.

Referring to an example shown in Figure 3, the divider 36 comprises a coupler 48 that mechanically splits the microwave frequency signal 34 into position sensing signals 38 and 38b transmitted along wave guides 50a and 50b. The reflected waves from the target components 52a and 52b are received by the wave guides 50a and 50b, as described above relative to Figure 2.

Figure 1 illustrates temperature sensors 40 used to correct or calibrate the return position sensing signals. Alternatively, the microwave frequency signal 34 may be used to calibrate the position sensing signals. In one example, the microwave frequency signal 34 includes first and second frequencies. The first frequency corresponds to a calibration signal 54 of a different frequency than the second frequency. The second frequency is used as a position sensing signal, as described above relative to Figures 1-3. The calibration signal 54 is sent to the coupler 48. A structural feature 56, such as a metallic feature or an alumina plug, may be arranged near the end of the wave guide 50. The first frequency is selected so that it is reflected by the structural feature 56 and returned to the processor 26. In this manner, the calibration signal 54 may be used to measure the effects of the temperature on the wave guide 50 so that any changes in its length due to temperature can be measured by the calibration signal 54. Adjustments to the position sensing signal can then be made using the calibration signal.
Although a preferred embodiment of this invention has been disclosed, a worker of ordinary skill in this art would recognize that certain modifications would come within the scope of this invention. For that reason, the following claims should be studied to determine the true scope and content of this invention.

claim.claim-text: Mikrowellenpositionserfassungssystem (12), aufweisend: eine Mehrzahl von Zielkomponenten (14, 18, 22, 24), von denen jede zwischen mehreren Positionen beweglich ist; eine Mikrowellenerzeugungseinrichtung (28), die ein Mikrowellenfrequenzsignal (34) erzeugt; und eine Teilungseinrichtung (36), die dafür konfiguriert ist, das Mikrowellenfrequenzsignal (34) zu empfangen, das Mikrowellenfrequenzsignal in eine Mehrzahl von Positionserfassungssignalen (38a -38e) zu teilen und die Positionserfassungssignale (38a -38e) an die Mehrzahl von Zielkomponenten (14, 18, 22, 24) zu schicken, um eine Position der zugehörigen Zielkomponente zu bestimmen, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass das Mikrowellenfrequenzsignal (34) ein Kalibrierungssignal (54), das auf einer ersten Frequenz arbeitet und vor Erreichen der Zielkomponente reflektiert wird, und mindestens eines der Mehrzahl von Positionserfassungssignalen (38a-38e), das einer zweiten Frequenz entspricht, die sich von der ersten Frequenz unterscheidet, umfasst.

System nach Anspruch 1, ferner aufweisend mindestens einen Wellenleiter (50), der dafür angeordnet ist, mindestens eines der Mehrzahl von Positionserfassungssignalen (38a, 38b) an eine entsprechende Zielkomponente (52a, 52b) zu liefern.
System nach Anspruch 2, wobei der oder jeder des mindestens einen Wellenleiters ein Strukturmerkmal (56) aufweist, das angeordnet ist, um die erste Frequenz zu reflektieren.

System nach Anspruch 1, 2 oder 3, wobei die Teilungseinrichtung (36) dafür ausgebildet ist, das Mikrowellenfrequenzsignal (34) mechanisch in die Mehrzahl von Positionserfassungssignalen (38a -38e) zu teilen.

System nach Anspruch 1, 2 oder 3, wobei die Teilungseinrichtung (36) dafür ausgebildet ist, das Mikrowellenfrequenzsignal (34) elektrisch in die Mehrzahl von Positionserfassungssignalen (38a -38e) zu teilen.

System nach Anspruch 2 oder 5, wobei mindestens ein elektrisches Kabel die Mehrzahl von Positionserfassungssignalen (38a -38e) zu mindestens einer Kopplungseinrichtung (48a, 48b) befördert, die mit dem mindestens einen Wellenleiter (50a, 50b) verbunden ist, wobei der mindestens eine Wellenleiter sich in der Nähe der Zielkomponente (52a, 52b) befindet.
System nach Anspruch 6, wobei die Teilungseinrichtung (36) zwischen der Mikrowellenerzeugungseinrichtung (28) und der Kopplungseinrichtung angeordnet ist.
System nach einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, wobei die Zielkomponenten (14, 18, 22, 24) einer Turbomaschine (10) zugeordnet sind.

System nach einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, wobei die Zielkomponenten mindestens eine der folgenden Komponenten aufweisen: ein Kraftstoffmessventil, einen Drehaktuator, einen Linearaktuator, eine variable Statorschaufel.

Verfahren zur Positionserfassung mittels Mikrowellen, das folgende Schritte beinhaltet: a) Übertragen eines Mikrowellenfrequenzsignals (34); b) Teilen des Mikrowellenfrequenzsignals in mehrere Positionserfassungssignale (38a -38e); c) Übertragen der mehreren Positionserfassungssignale (38a -38e) an eine Mehrzahl von Zielkomponenten (14, 18, 22, 24); und d) Bestimmen einer Position jeder der Zielkomponenten (14, 18, 22, 24) unter Verwendung der mehreren Positionserfassungssignale (38a -38e); gekennzeichnet durch: e) Verwendung eines Kalibrierungssignals (54) zur Einstellung der mehreren Positionserfassungssignale (38a - 38e),
wobei das Kalibrierungssignal (54) bei einer ersten Frequenz ist und vor Erreichen der Zielkomponente reflektiert wird, und das Positionserfassungssignal (38) bei einer zweiten Frequenz ist, die sich von der ersten Frequenz unterscheidet; und
wobei das Mikrowellenfrequenzsignal (38) das Kalibrierungssignal und die Positionserfassungssignale enthält.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 10, wobei Schritt b) das mechanische Teilen des Mikrowellenfrequenzsignals (34) in die mehreren Positionserfassungssignale (38a - 38e) beinhaltet.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 10, wobei Schritt b) das elektrische Teilen des Mikrowellenfrequenzsignals (34) in die mehreren Positionserfassungssignale (38a - 38e) beinhaltet.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 10, 11 oder 12, wobei Schritt a) das Übertragen der ersten und der zweiten Frequenz durch einen gemeinsamen Wellenleiter (50) beinhaltet, wobei die erste und zweite Frequenz dem Mikrowellenfrequenzsignal bzw. einem Positionserfassungssignal entsprechen, und wobei Schritt e) beinhaltet: Reflektieren der ersten Frequenz vor Erreichen der Zielkomponente (14, 18, 22, 24), um ein Kalibrierungssignal (54) zu erzeugen; und Kalibrieren eines der zweiten Frequenz zugeordneten Positionserfassungssignals (38) unter Verwendung des Kalibrierungssignals (54).

Verfahren nach Anspruch 13, wobei der Wellenleiter (50) ein strukturelles Merkmal (56) aufweist und der Schritt des Reflektierens das Reflektieren der ersten Frequenz mittels des strukturellen Merkmals (56) beinhaltet.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 14, wobei das strukturelle Merkmal ein metallisches Merkmal oder ein Aluminiumanschluss in der Nähe des Endes des Wellenleiters ist.
Verfahren nach einem der Ansprüche 10 bis 15, das einen Temperatursensor (40a - 40e) beinhaltet, der das Kalibrierungssignal erzeugt.

A microwave position sensing system (12) comprising: a plurality of target components (14, 18, 22, 24) each movable between multiple positions; a microwave generator (28) producing a microwave frequency signal (34); and a divider (36) configured to receive the microwave frequency signal (34), to split the microwave frequency signal into a plurality of position sensing signals (38a-38e), and to send the position sensing signals (38a-38e) to the plurality of target components (14, 18, 22, 24) for determining a position of the target component associated therewith, characterised in that the microwave frequency signal (34) includes a calibration signal (54) operating at a first frequency and reflected prior to reacting the target component, and at least one of the plurality of position sensing signals (38a-38e) corresponding to a second frequency that is different from the first frequency.

The system of claim 1, further comprising at least one wave guide (50) arranged to deliver at least one of the plurality of position sensing signals (38a,38b) to a respective target component (52a, 52b).
The system of claim 2, wherein the or each of the at least one wave guide includes a structural feature (56) arranged to reflect the first frequency.
The system according to claim 1, 2 or 3 wherein the divider (36) is adapted to mechanically split the microwave frequency signal (34) into the plurality of position sensing signals (38a-38e).
The system according to claim 1, 2 or 3, wherein the divider (36) is adapted to electrically split the microwave frequency signal (34) into the plurality of position sensing signals (38a-38e).

The system according to claim 2 and 5, wherein at least one electrical cable is adapted to carry the plurality of position sensing signals (38a-38e) to at least one coupler (48a, 48b) that is connected to the at least one wave guide (50a, 50b), the at least one wave guide being proximate to the target component (52a, 52b).
The system according to claim 6, wherein the divider (36) is arranged between the microwave generator (28) and the coupler.
The system according to any preceding claim, wherein the target components (14, 18, 22, 24) are associated with a turbo machine (10).
The system according to any preceding claim, wherein the target components comprise at least one of: a fuel metering valve, a rotary actuator, a linear actuator and a variable stator vane.
The method according to claim 10, wherein step b) includes dividing the microwave signal (34) mechanically into the multiple position sensing signals (38a-38e).
The method according to claim 10, wherein step b) includes dividing the microwave signal (34) electrically into the multiple position sensing signals (38a-38e).

The method according to claim 10, 11 or 12, wherein step a) includes transmitting the first and second frequencies through a common wave guide (50), the first and second frequencies respectively corresponding to the microwave signal and a position sensing signal, and wherein step e) comprises: reflecting the first frequency prior to reaching the target component (14, 18, 22, 24) to produce a calibration signal (54); and calibrating a position sensing signal (38) associated with the second frequency using the calibration signal (54).
The method according to claim 13, wherein the wave guide (50) includes a structural feature (56), and the reflecting step includes reflecting the first frequency with the structural feature (56).
The method according to claim 14, wherein the structural feature is a metallic feature or an alumina plug near the end of the wave guide.
The method according to any one of claims 10 to 15, comprising a temperature sensor (40a-40e) producing the calibration signal.

Système de détection de position à micro-ondes (12), comprenant : une pluralité de composants cibles (14, 18, 22, 24), chacun étant mobile entre de multiples positions ; un générateur de micro-ondes (28) produisant un signal de fréquence de micro-ondes (34) ; et un diviseur (36) configuré pour recevoir le signal de fréquence de micro-ondes (34), scinder le signal de fréquence de micro-ondes en une pluralité de signaux de détection de position (38a-38e) et envoyer les signaux de détection de position (38a-38e) à la pluralité de composants cibles (14, 18, 22, 24) pour déterminer une position du composant cible qui leur est associé, caractérisé en ce que le signal de fréquence de micro-ondes (34) comprend un signal d'étalonnage (54) opérant à une première fréquence et réfléchi avant d'atteindre le composant cible ainsi qu'au moins un de la pluralité de signaux de détection de position (38a-38e) correspondant à une seconde fréquence qui est différente de la première fréquence.

Système selon la revendication 1, comprenant par ailleurs au moins un guide d'ondes (50) aménagé pour délivrer au moins l'un de la pluralité de signaux de détection de position (38a, 38b) à un composant cible respectif (52a, 52b).
Système selon la revendication 2, dans lequel le ou chaque au moins un guide d'ondes comprend une caractéristique structurelle (56) aménagée pour réfléchir la première fréquence.

Système selon la revendication 1, 2 ou 3, dans lequel le diviseur (36) est à même de scinder mécaniquement le signal de fréquence de micro-ondes (34) en la pluralité de signaux de détection de position (38a-38e).

Système selon la revendication 1, 2 ou 3, dans lequel le diviseur (36) est à même de scinder électriquement le signal de fréquence de micro-ondes (34) en la pluralité de signaux de détection de position (38a-38e).

Système selon les revendications 2 et 5, dans lequel au moins un câble électrique est à même d'acheminer la pluralité de signaux de détection de position (38a-38e) à au moins un coupleur (48a, 48b) qui est connecté au au moins un guide d'ondes (50a, 50b), le au moins un guide d'ondes étant proche du composant cible (52a, 52b).
Système selon la revendication 6, dans lequel le diviseur (36) est aménagé entre le générateur de micro-ondes (28) et le coupleur.
Système selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel les composants cibles (14, 18, 22, 24) sont associés à une turbomachine (10).

Système selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel les composants cibles comprennent au moins un élément parmi une soupape de dosage de carburant, un actionneur rotatif, un actionneur linéaire et une aube de stator variable.
Procédé selon la revendication 10, dans lequel l'étape b) comprend la division du signal de micro-ondes (34) mécaniquement en multiples signaux de détection de position (38a-38e).
Procédé selon la revendication 10, dans lequel l'étape b) comprend la division du signal de micro-ondes (34) électriquement en multiples signaux de détection de position (38a-38e).

Procédé selon la revendication 10, 11 ou 12, dans lequel l'étape a) comprend la transmission de la première et de la seconde fréquence à travers un guide d'ondes commun (50), la première et la seconde fréquence correspondant respectivement au signal de micro-ondes et à un signal de détection de position, et dans lequel l'étape e) comprend : la réflexion de la première fréquence avant d'atteindre le composant cible (14, 18, 22, 24) pour produire un signal d'étalonnage (54) ; et l'étalonnage d'un signal de détection de position (38) associé à la seconde fréquence en utilisant le signal d'étalonnage (54).

Procédé selon la revendication 13, dans lequel le guide d'ondes (50) comprend une caractéristique structurelle (56) et l'étape de réflexion comprend la réflexion de la première fréquence avec la caractéristique structurelle (56).
Procédé selon la revendication 14, dans lequel la caractéristique structurelle est une caractéristique métallique ou un obturateur d'alumine à proximité de l'extrémité du guide d'ondes.
Procédé selon l'une quelconque des revendications 10 à 15, comprenant un capteur de température (40a-40e) produisant le signal d'étalonnage.
